result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyontae Kinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Domestic Abuse Crime [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(8).
  • Contempt of Court/Disobey Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.01(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 189 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: -No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Provide DNA Sample.

supervisions.notes:
-Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges (DNA) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent, with credit for 189 DAYS time served.

-Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges (DNA) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyontae Kinney in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Kyontae Kinney.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing held. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements made by Demetrice L., Ruby L., and Antoine B.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 10 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 189 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 5 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 189 DAYS time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
-Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges (DNA) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
REINSTATING communication privileges, signed and filed.
filed.

Defendant Kyontae Kinney in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Kyontae Kinney in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Jury Trial. Defense counsel advises that there has been a change in circumstances and the parties are now in a resolution posture. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Counts 1, and 2: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

efense counsel requests communication privileges be re-instated. No objections from the State. Court grants request and re-instates communication privileges.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Kyontae Kinney not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Defendant not produced. Court adjourns matter for 07/25/2022 date, due to court calendar congestion. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Offer Letter
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions

Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Received and Filed. Plea Addendum

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Kyontae Kinney not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's motion to join, filed.
SIGNATURE NOT NEEDED, filed.
RESCINDING defendant's telephone, visitation and U.S. mail custody privileges, signed and filed.
filed.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Kyontae Kinney not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held. For reasons stated on the record, State to submit a modified order to to the court resciding the defendant's telephone, visitation, and U.S. mail custody privileges. Order signed and filed. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 29.
and intent to pursue forfeiture by wrongdoing, filed.

Court ordered no contact with DIB (1/4/98); OAB (7/2/83)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring;  24/7 curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical and legal appointments..  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $40,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty to Counts 1 and 2.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Defense request bail hearing to address State's Motion to Rescind Communication.

Defendant Kyontae Kinney in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Kyontae Kinney in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyontae Kinney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
